description: Trump Media shares surged over the most recent two trading days — but the company continues to weather a miserable run since its stock market debut last month.
title: Trump Media shares surge after a miserable run. Pros say stay away

description: Police began making dozens of arrests after Columbia University's president asked for help clearing protesters — citing the "encampment and related disruptions pose a clear and present danger."
title: NYPD breaks up pro-Palestinian protest at Columbia University

description: The Food and Drug Administration warns Trader Joe's customers in dozens of states to throw out fresh basil after a federal investigation linked the product to a salmonella outbreak.
title: Trader Joe's recalls basil linked to 12 salmonella infections in 7 states

description: The U.N. Security Council met Thursday to debate and vote on the Palestinian application for full membership in the United Nations, which would allow it to vote during U.N. proceedings.
title: What to know about the U.N. vote on whether to admit Palestinians as full members

description: H-Pop is the Indian popular music and poetry of Hindu nationalism. But critics worry that the music is spreading hate and encourages violence against Muslims.
title: Is a Popular Music Genre in India Spreading Hate?

description: The influential guitarist, songwriter and singer was best known for the song "Ramblin' Man." Betts's blues, rock and country-influenced guitar style helped define Southern rock in the 1960s and '70s.
title: Dickey Betts, founding member of the Allman Brothers Band, dies at 80

description: As local elected officials continue to face pressure to pass resolutions calling for an end to the fighting in Gaza, some aren't sure how or whether to take a stand at all.
title: Gaza cease-fire resolutions roil U.S. local communities

description: Nearly a third of China's urban population lives in areas that are subsiding, according to a sweeping national survey of 82 major Chinese cities. In coastal areas, that makes sea level rise worse.
title: China's cities are sinking, putting tens of millions at risk

description: Nearly 1-in-4 adults who lost Medicaid coverage in the past year are now uninsured, according to a new survey. As states winnow the rolls, many families are caught in confusing red tape.
title: Florida kicked their son off Medicaid in the 'unwinding' but not their daughter

description: The Kennedys have been critical of Robert F. Kennedy's third-party run, which has the potential to draw votes away from President Biden — who the family is formally endorsing on Thursday.
title: The Kennedys are endorsing Biden, not their family member RFK Jr.

description: The grass pea is one: a hardy crop that can thrive in a drought. An agriculturist is spearheading an effort to diversity what farmers grow as climate change threatens staples like corn and wheat.
title: What are 'orphan crops'? And why is there a new campaign to get them adopted?

description: Writers for the children's program want better residuals and annual raises, and for auxiliary works, such as social media segments, to be covered by union benefits. Their contract expires Friday.
title: 'Sesame Street' writers authorize a strike if they don't reach a contract by Friday

description: The number of U.S. children dying from gunshot wounds has climbed in recent years. Keeping guns out of reach is one way to curb the trend — others argue to teach kids to handle guns responsibly.
title: Amid concerns about kids and guns, some say training is the answer

description: Guns are now the leading cause of death among American children. And many more children are injured in shootings, putting them at risk for life-altering disability, pain, and mental trauma.
title: Guns are killing more U.S. children. Shooting survivors can face lifelong challenges

description: Haiti is on the verge of collapse, with little to no government. But many Haitians have already learned to live without the support of the state, as NPR discovered traveling to Cap-Haïtien.
title: A portrait of Haitians trying to survive without a government

description: More than 5 million college students are also parents. But many colleges do little to support them. Most don't even offer child care.
title: College is hard enough — try doing it while raising kids

description: Lots of older Americans say they'd love to downsize, but it doesn't make financial sense. The housing roadblock has left some would-be buyers stuck. We asked experts what policies could change that.
title: Many baby boomers own homes that are too big. Can they be enticed to sell them?

description: Our sun was born in a cosmic cradle with thousands of other stars. Astrophysicists say they want to find these siblings in order to help answer the question: Are we alone out there?
title: COMIC: Our sun was born with thousands of other stars. Where did they all go?

description: A study showed states made more mistakes when executing Black prisoners by lethal injection than they did with prisoners of other races. Execution workers and race experts said they're not surprised.
title: States botched more executions of Black prisoners. Experts think they know why

description: Indonesian authorities closed an airport and residents left homes near an erupting volcano Thursday due to the dangers of spreading ash, falling rocks, and the possibility of a tsunami.
title: Indonesians leave homes near erupting volcano and airport closes due to ash danger

description: Whether it's pesticides in your cereal or the door plug flying off your airplane, consumers today have plenty of reasons to feel like corporations might not have their best interests at heart. At a moment where we're seeing unprecedented product recalls, and when trust in the government is near historic lows, we're going to revisit a time when a generation of people felt empowered to demand accountability from both companies and elected leaders — and got results. Today on the show, the story of the U.S. consumer movement and its controversial leader: the once famous, now infamous Ralph Nader.
title: Ralph Nader, Consumer Crusader

description: Former President Donald Trump met Wednesday with Polish President Andrzej Duda, the latest in a series of meetings with foreign leaders as they brace for the possibility of a second Trump term.
title: Poland's president visits Donald Trump as allies eye a possible return

description: The U.S. Justice Department has agreed to pay approximately $100 million to settle claims with about 100 people who say they were sexually assaulted by sports doctor Larry Nassar.
title: Lawyers for Nassar assault survivors have reached $100M deal with Justice Department
